author: felixweber
title: Ledger Live Integration
description: Ledgerのユーザーは、ADAを管理するためにサードパーティのウォレットに依存する必要があり、これが混乱の原因となり、ユーザーがハッキングされる可能性が高くなります。

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the problem of ADA holders having to install 3rd  party wallets to manage their ADA. They will ad value to the Cardano ecosystem by giving ADA holders more security and quality of life when managing their ADA. There isn't much key metrics provided so its hard to see if it is inline with the challenge setting. The proposal is based on an open source integration of Ledger so it is aligned with the Challenge in that sense. The proposal is able to scale as long term maintenance costs will be covered by Ladger.
f6_assessments.q1: The relevant skills and team has been provided and proven via github links. The budget is reasonable and broken down in the long term and the funding requested will fund the first phase. There are 3 phases in total. The other phases will be discussed in the future. They explain what the functions will be of what they are building, but they don't provide the technical details of how they will build it. They do however provide Github links so if anyone needs more technical information they can find it in the Github links. The time to complete the first phase is 2 months which is great because it will already ad usability. They haven't considered any risks, but given the huge teams behind this and the open source aspect, should make them quite resilient to risks/challnges.
f6_assessments.q2: They provided roadmap with 3 milestones. No measurable KPIs were provided, but since it is already an established brand, they are already bringing more users to Cardano. They adress the problem of ADA holders having to install 3rd party apps to manage their ADA on Ledger Live. They solve this by collaborating with ADA community and building the necessary product to aid ADA holders.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer want to enable native support for cardano in ledger live. Down the road there might be staking and related daps available in ledger live. There's a clear goal to open source the integration with ledger live, which makes this proposal fit the challenge it's in. There's a clear message about the value that will be added to the cardano ecosystem through: employing valued members of the community, strenghtening trust and relations between the community and ledger live, bringing a significatnt codebase to be open sourced, used and developed by everyone interested and capable. They've chosen to Send / Receive and Synch ADA accounts on Ledger Live Desktop and Ledger Live Mobile as a phase 1 of the proposal and the indicators if that is done will be evident inapplications. Keeping in mind the teama sitting behind this proposal I have no doubt that they will be able to scale and face any of the mentioned challenges.  What's missing in the ecosystem right now are big companies collaborating with the community. This project is a perfect first step to bring the community closer to the providers of hardware wallets. As a developer I don't have any concerns about this proposal and am looking forward to it.
f6_assessments.q1: There are referal links which I managed to verify and checked out the mentioned team members and team members mentioned in the proposal. If voted in, the people working on this proposal are capable of completing the goal within the time limit.  The budget could be better broken down to explain the exact number stated as needed funds. It isn't transparent enough where the funds will be going and the calculation made in order to come up with the stated required funds. Nevertheless there's a realistic timetable to complete the first phase of the work without an issue. The technical part of the explanation isn't described, but if anyone is interested there are links in the proposal with the codebase which will be used in relation to the integration. So if anyone is interested, there are link to dig though. It's described what resources will be necessary to implement the proposal, but again I wished they were a bit more specific on the technical side of things.  The considered risk are relevant, but it's always better when you're prepared.  Overall a good proposal, I wish you the best of luck! And may the community be with you!
f6_assessments.q2: One thing I'm not worried about after reading the proposal is the tracability of the project. The authors took special care to list several ways to interact and to enable a channel allowing them to listen to the community. There are discord channels as well as regular AMA meetings. KPIs are missing but not exactly. Since there will be a github repository anyone interested would be able to see the implementation progress being done in there. The roadmap not only for this solution but for future funding rounds and ideas are also presented in this proposal, which is nice because it allows the people to see the way the proposal isheaded. There's a clear and understandable description of the targeted problem and a solution explanation to match.

f6_assessments.q0: Wow! Ledger Live integration is brought to us by Catalyst funding. This is really amazing! The impact no doubtful will be very great, especially for every Hodler out there who uses hardware wallet Ledger. We can better manage our ADA assets via Ledger Live.
f6_assessments.q1: I won't doubt this project will be 100% successful. From the budget and time frame perspective, plus support from the Strica team, it shouldn't be that hard for Phase 1. BUT, will there be any risk of "centralization" because we will be using Strica's backend? Why don't we just buy it from them? And how's the legality of this service? To whom does Strica make the agreement? What are the SLA and backup plans if there's something wrong with their backend?
f6_assessments.q2: We only need to see the Ledger Live seeing the project status. It's pretty obvious.  And as communities, we need to make sure the proposers and the support team will deliver the project on time based on the milestones.

f6_assessments.q0: The need for a single platform to manage, stake, and transact ADA is addressed wonderfully by the proposal. The inadequacy of such platforms and continuous dependence on 3rd party wallets have constantly raised concerns amongst the community regarding the vulnerabilities it possesses. However, the proposer conveys their plan to mitigate the same and also addresses the elephant in the room, the "Open-source nature" of the application which can trigger further contributions to the ecosystem. The support page and "Ask me anything" features could have huge ramifications across the community and provide ample support to the new faces making their way to the Cardano chain. Hence, I would score full marks for the impact aspect of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience the above-mentioned team comes into this challenge is immense. The team has had several prior triumphs and has made contributions that are absolute winners. The detailed plan of integration of Cardano to Ledger is profusely narrated. The technical specifications provided through the links show the credibility in the proposal, with the future plans of funding through further rounds showing the sheer commitment and passion the team carries in order to make this a success and add another trophy to their collection. The phase-wise implementation strategy and a moderate amount of groundwork add more weightage to the feasibility criteria. The funds requested seem practical and plausible given the amount of work involved and the anticipated high quality of the solution. The elucidated proposal with lucid goals seals the deal. Hence, I make no reservation in scoring the feasibility full marks.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer makes no mistake in providing the community with metrics that does absolute justice to the proposal. The open-source nature of the solution makes it easier for the auditors to track the progress. The number of ADA transactions and the increase in ADA wallet sync ups in Ledger add more insight to the success of the proposal. The above metrics being in alignment with the challenge's expectations makes the proposal a clear winner in the segment. Provided with the above rationale, I strongly believe that the audit process would be easy and prolific.

f6_assessments.q0:
Ledger Live and the Guild Operators are both well known groups within the cardano space. The need to have a LedgerLive is a valid and will bring value to both ecosystems. 
The proposed project to start including the phase 1 for ledger live support of cardano wallets will allieviate alot of strain for newcomers into ADA. 
The proposal describes the initial steps clearly and if completed will provide value
f6_assessments.q1:
Since the teams described to participate in this proposal are two integral components to achieve this goal. From the ledger side the team will be able to impletement the necessary code and from the backend the Guild operators will be able to link the cardano chain. 
My experience from seing both groups interact this will lead to a succesful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
Provided the timeline and objectives are clear. In addition they have relayed the basic tasks and actions that will be implemented in the phase 1.
Phase 1 has listed the basic deliverables that be easily audited and tested once running.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement targets on the issue with ADA holders to rely on third party wallets for all the transactions and management of their assets and the solution proposed is integrating cardano native token support into ledger live which is a well established platform to perform all the crypto management. this solution aptly addresses the problem statement as ledger live application can be then one stop for all the ADA related transactions
f6_assessments.q1: As the proposers have mentioned that the team is a collaboration of ledger team which is a leading contributor in crypto community provisioning multiple hardware wallets and platform for crypto management and strica team which is sole contributor and maintainer for cardanoscan platform, This collaboration is highly potential in bring this proposal to reality in addition the ambassadors guild expertise for the same enhances this potential to implement this proposal successfully
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has provided phase wise plan of the implementation of the plan with details on specifications and have also mentioned well defined deliverables which can be great metric for measuring the progress of the proposal execution and the fund usage being straightly monitored for ledger live integration only by leading community members and ambassadors authenticates auditing the proposal success.

solution: Ledger LiveにADAとCardano Nativeトークンのサポートを追加し、ADAホルダーが1つのアプリケーションでデジタル資産を管理できるようになりました。
experience: Ledger Team、Strica ( Cardanoscan ) 、The Ambassadors guildは、この提案を成功させるために必要な専門知識とスキルを提供しています。
